frameDefinitions: In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
A Tourist experiences an Attraction, a location with a unique history or other societally recognized individual character, with the goal of seeing and learning about it.
The adjectives and nouns in this frame describe an Experiencer who is feeling or experiencing a particular emotional response to a Stimulus or about a Topic.
An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having a surprised emotion as evoked by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.
An Experiencer, Expressor, or State has a feeling of annoyance as evoked by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.
Some phenomenon (the Stimulus) provokes a particular emotion in an Experiencer.
frameExamples: The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
Mr. Whiskers is <t>upset</t> that there are no more cat treats.
I was more <t>shocked</t> about the child than she was.
Nightmare on Elm Street <t>scared</t> me silly.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The individual that is seeking an experience at an Attraction.
The societally-recognized unique location that the <fen>Tourist</fen> experiences.
The time that the touring takes place.
The location where the touring takes place.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> reacts emotionally or psychologically to the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the event or entity which brings about the emotional or psychological state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
Nan Ho turned, <fex>his</fex> extreme agitation unnoticed by the Prince.
Liz's anger <fex>towards Raquel</fex> dates back to a charity dinner this year.
'Can I help you?' she asked, trying not to let him see the amusement <fex>in her blue eyes</fex>.
The end of the film was filled with jubilant <fex>scenes</fex>.
<fex>The news</fex> greatlyalarms all the women of the village.
